showScoreExcerpt:
"While ‘A Bronx Tale’ never exactly falsifies its subject, it gives the effect of skating over everything lightly, never quite coming to grips with the grit it touches on…Within these limitations, ‘A Bronx Tale’ has its good points…The Menken-Slater songs, carefully crafted in period-pastiche forms, supply pleasantly accurate atmosphere…The overall result isn't bad, just a little bland for the vital matters involved."
